newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistani cotton rates close steady, seen stable.
newsitem.headline: Pakistani cotton rates close steady, seen stable.

text.p: Pakistani cotton rates closed steady on Saturday in thin trade, brokers said.
Trading was dull due to a liquidity crunch and most spinners who bought cotton for their immediate needs had gone to the sidelines, broker Oveis Razzak said.
In the kerb market, the rates for NIAB-78 ranged from 2,350 to 2,375 rupees per maund (37.32 kg), he said. Little change was expected on Sunday.
Saturday's Karachi Cotton Association official spot rates in rupees per maund including 10 percent sales tax:
